lines.text: This is General Retailers, Cuttlebury.
[pause]
Eh?
[pause]
Eh?
[pause]
Mr Penny's office? Yes.
[pause]
Eh?
[pause]
Eh?
[pause]
Eh?
Don't keep saying "A" like that. Use another letter occasionally.
Oh.
That's better. What do they want?
You.
I? Why?
Don't argue with me. Attend to your job. What are you supposed to be doing?
Sticking these bits of paper into this here book.
Oh. What are they?
I don't know. I thought you did.
Don't be impertinent. Of course I do.
[Addresses secretary]
What are all these things he's got here, Miss Corker?
I suppose they're entries for the ledger.
Don't be absurd. The Leger was run last month.
I don't object to your keeping company with somebody decent.
No, no, no. I want to keep company only with you.
I didn't know you'd be free tonight. I'd have bet ten to one you had a date with some Willy.
So! You will bet like this on my Willy, but if you find me with some poor Willy, you boot him!
A woman like you shouldn't want Willys.
No, but a man like you should want Trixies, is it?
Certainly. The more he sees of them, the more he appreciates his wife.
You've got to the stage where your friends ought to be your own age, sex, and size.
I've always been a loving husband to you, Heaven knows.
Oh, make no mistake, Heaven does not know much about you. The angels are not permitted to listen to that sort of thing.
You know, poor Father and Mother think I'm still a kid.
I'm glad to hear that. I believe in children keeping their parents as innocent as possible.
Do you know the disreputable kind of people who go there?
Well, I've often been there.
Have you? I've never seen you.
You don't kidnap ladies in England. You don't have to.
No man who's been married to you could ever possibly want another wife.
